content.question: A conducting rod is sliding at a speed of <math alttext="4.5 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> along conducting rails that are <math alttext="0.75 meter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.75</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> apart. The rails are attached to a <math alttext="5.0 ohms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Î©</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> resistor, completing a loop. The loop is in a <math alttext="250 milliteslas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>250</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> magnetic field that is directed out of the page, as shown. The current generated in the resistor is

choices.label: <math alttext="0.17 ampere" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.17</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> counterclockwise

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
